messages.content:
Hi Buddy Group 🥇! Nice to meet you all!

I am Malin in Luxembourg. 

0 coding experience but after having watched Dragana’s webinar on agnetic AI I am getting super excited to start to try something out. 

What I do have experience in is ethics and AI after having worked on that for the company I work at. 

Looking forward to our interactions!

Hi Buddy Group 1 <@1364826411566764043> <@1359955242438889545> <@1364721820313456643> <@1364837264827617284> <@1364899385866981390> nice to meet you all! I’m Andrea, based in Munich and me favorite emoji is 🍑 . I am super excited to be part of this Buddy Group. 🎯 Why I’m in this community: I’m on a learning journey to deepen my leadership in the age of GenAI & Agents – especially as a non-tech person navigating AI transformation in B2B. I'm passionate about shaping future-ready Revenue Engines and will soon dive into Python basics (because yes… debugging without it is humbling 😉). 🔍 What drives me:
Exploring how GenAI affects Processes, Ethics, Agility, Compliance, and Human impact – or, as I call it thankx to the input of <@673901899837341736> , my “PEACH” Leadership Compass.  If you want to connect me on linked in here is my profile: https://www.linkedin.com/in/andrea-hickethier-65449aa0/
💬 Looking forward to growing together, exchanging real-world insights, and supporting each other along the way!  Let’s get started 🚀

Q&A prep  - let's get ready. Dear Buddy Group <@1364826411566764043> <@1359955242438889545> <@1364721820313456643> <@1364837264827617284> <@1364899385866981390> On Thursday, we will have another opportunity to submit questions for Friday's Q&A session! 🎯
<@1359955242438889545> and I would love to suggest that we collect our potential questions here in this channel by tomorrow evening.
What do you think?

We imagine that each of us is engaged in different conversations and channels — and together, we probably have lots of great ideas for Q&A!
Let's kick it off and start sharing! 🚀

Sounds perfect! 🥳  Will think of dome topics. 

(Just also checking if you saw my intro above? Otherwise I will re-introduce myself. 😅)

Here is one: 

The EU is trying to regulate AI and Big Tech through acts like the Digital Markets Act (DMA) and the AI Act. But many say that enforcement is the real weakness. From a technical perspective, what would make enforcement more feasible in practice?

<@1364826411566764043> <@1364721820313456643> <@1364837264827617284> <@1364899385866981390> <@1361976806651068517> 
Lovely to connect and look forward to driving some interesting topics in Buddy #1 together with you. Thanks Malin for launching the intro's. 👍 
 🎯  With a background in management consulting, finance/private banking, and launch of a fintech (first digital private bank in Switzerland), Im a firm believer of digital transformation and would like to advise boards and starts ups on their GenAI and agentic transformations.  Im also a believer of technology transformation and the good it can derive in terms of democratising access and levelling the playing field for more to have access , compete and shape their lives in the world we are living in today and for our next generation !
Looking forward to learning together and hopefully have some fun moments too 😆 `

<@1359955242438889545> <@1364826411566764043> <@1361976806651068517> <@1364721820313456643> <@1364899385866981390> 
Thank you for the introductions, it's lovely to join this powerful group! 🦸‍♀️ 

I guess it's my turn 😊  I’m Laure, joining from Zurich, Switzerland. I’ve spent the past 15 years leading marketing, growth, and communications strategies across EMEA for global professional services organizations (with a focus on digital transformation).

Lately, I’ve been really interested in the practical side of AI—especially how we can:
    1.    integrate it into marketing strategies by enhancing planning, targeting, and campaign execution,
    2.    rethink how we work by redesigning workflows, collaboration, and creative processes, and
    3.    improve core marketing operations, from content creation to personalization and decision-making.

A big part of what matters to me is how we build and maintain trust with clients and ensure brand safety as we start integrating GenAI into more customer-facing areas.

Really looking forward to connecting with you all and sharing ideas as we learn together! ✨
Hi Malin, thank you for sharing. I am on my way to Munich and will look into this later this day.
Hi Laure, nice to meet you!

Hi <@1364826411566764043>, thanks for bringing this up – that’s a really relevant and timely angle, especially with the EU AI Act moving into implementation.

One idea I would like to share: we might slightly reframe the question to invite a more technical take – for example, what kind of design or architectural choices could actually support enforcement, beyond policy intent?

Something like:
“The EU AI Act is often criticized for weak enforcement mechanisms. From a technical or architectural perspective, what innovations or system-level designs could make such regulations more enforceable in practice?”

That could open the floor for insights on auditability, explainability, or even cultural implementation – areas Dr. Sanchez often highlights.

What do you think – would that resonate with the spirit of your question?
Yes, this is a really good idea! All for!

Hi Laure! Thanks for your intro!  
I think it is super interesting with the customer facing AI usage as well. To launch that, one really needs to consider its audience. Some will like it, some will absolutely not like it. Also, customers and especially consumers will be judgemental - one bad experience will have effect for a really long time with a client and they will likely also complain to others, quickly leading to effects on the brand. 

Someone wrote in one of the bigger groups or in the course forums (can’t remember) about creating almost emotionally intelligent AIs based on historic data so the AI  answer in a tone that resonates with the person (who might eg be upset about something). Too happy tone might annoy but striking the balance of that is very interesting!
Perfect!
Yes, interesting question, lets go with this for our Q&A submission today.

<@1364837264827617284> <@1364826411566764043> <@1361976806651068517> <@1364721820313456643> <@1364899385866981390> 
Interesting topic given importance of customer function being central to GenAI implementations. From protecting a well established brand to building trust for a new brand,  achieving the right level of personalisation, complying with applicable regulations, and for us being in Europe what data can you collect balancing compliance and business interests,....would this be a theme we would like to explore for next weeks Q&A ?

I agree 100% I am currently working on this topic GenAI along the Customer Journey. I am very interested in learning more. I have published an article about this some time ago. If you are interested here is the link: https://medium.com/@andrea.hickethier/from-automation-to-orchestration-how-to-lead-ai-agents-with-purpose-650fa27c3e64
<@1361976806651068517> Thank you for submitting 👏

Love the article, <@1361976806651068517>  This really resonates. The shift from automation to orchestration captures so much of what I’ve been thinking about lately. The PEACH framework is such a helpful way to bring structure to decisions beyond deployment. Now i understand why the peach emoji 😊

Now that I finally managed to find my way to the buddy group, let me advance a quick intro. 😉

Hi all! 👋🏼
My name is René. I live in Zurich, Switzerland. I run digitalization and organization transformation initiatives as a program and project manager. I am focused on the financial services industry (banks, insurance companies), for which I have worked with different angles: in Consulting, within a bank, and with a Fintech. 
I was thrilled to do the ‘Applied GenAI for Digital Transformation” MIT course. It brought me new perspectives and a deepened understanding. I believe it brought me to the point where I can jump to the next level of applying GenAI in business and projects. Making sure to exploit new potentials for digitalization and running transformation initiatives. 
I would love to exchange with you in this group and continue to learn together about how to best exploit GenAI. Please do not hesitate to reach out to me. You also find me on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/rene-m-jost/ 
Best regards 
René  😃
<@1364573571686334547> Hi René.  Welcome to our Buddy group. Can you see the earlier posts in this Buddy groups (intro's of different individuals, Q&A topics ?)
Hi Marie! First message I see is Malin's intro on 28.04.2025.
<@1364573571686334547> Good, yes, that is where thread started. Best from Geneva
Hi <@1364573571686334547>, great to have you with us! Greetings from Zurich  ☀️
Greetings back from a sunny Tessinerplatz  😎 ☀️

@everyone
Reminder: We’re having our Q&A session on Zoom with Dr. Sanchez today at 11:30 AM EST!

Zoom Link: https://mit.zoom.us/j/97336834725

Looking forward to seeing you all there! Don’t miss it
🧠✨

<@1364837264827617284> <@1364573571686334547> <@1364826411566764043> <@1361976806651068517>  Have you all had a go at beginning to build agents? Dont miss Sundays presentation by Jose and check out showcases for the agents. Andrea is already off to a headstart, so we can learn with her ! 🎉
Hi <@1359955242438889545> I did not have the opportunity to join this session on Sunday. Will look for a replay 🙂
<@1364573571686334547> Great and interesting session, specifically if you are keen to build agents w RAG !

Hi all! Sorry for the silence from my side, has been a hectic week with other priorities. Thanks for the suggestion <@1359955242438889545> I will get that recording going. 

So far I have built very simple GPTs in ChatGPT. One relates to calculating a specific date which was surprisingly difficult. I think my main learning from that was that less is more. As we learned from the course we should give it the bigger picture rather than narrowing its mind to one’s own perspective. 

That is also an important thing to keep in mind for building agents. The first one I am about to kick off is a crossword assistant.  There I said it, so I will have to report back now. 😄🤝

Dear Buddy Group I would like to encourage all of us to come us with suggestion for the Q and A this week. Have you discovered interesting things where you have questions? My suggestion would be: “In dynamic AI environments, how can we implement ISO-like governance frameworks (e.g. ISO/IEC 42001) without stifling agility and innovation? What are key design patterns that balance certifiability with adaptiveness?”
Hi! I think this is a really good question.
Sure, Im fine with this question for the Q&A this week. Thanks for the proposal.
@everyone

Hey team,

Really enjoyed the session with Abel and John today!

One thing that stuck with me was the point about “less is more,” especially when we’re all using tools like ChatGPT. It can be super helpful, but also risky if we just keep building on long threads or documents without stepping back - it will be interesting when we see big cases where this has financial and legal effects. It is also an important reminder to managers to train people early in their careers (and others too perhaps) that that they are accountable for the output. 

I am interested in the security bit and I saw you had a question about that too <@1359955242438889545>. If anyone’s read something good on that, send it my way! 

Have an awesome Friday!

@Malin Yes, agree, it was a really good session. Simplifying is certainly the way to go for greater buy in and adoption, however as we strive for democratisation and access to these technologies, how about the security aspects and repercussions  among a broader population that may not have access to AI literacy programs ?
Here is one idea for Question to next week's Q&A: When deepfakes become real-time and open source, how do we defend truth  in a world where seeing and hearing is no longer believing and trustworthy?

Hope you are all having a great weekend. Sharing an article fr FT that I found interesting. As we learnt from course, most agents can perform steps in a task but still need the human orcestrator, biggest immediate winds are cost and productivity (not big revenue streams), and how finance and industry rely heavily on the human employee acting as competent supervisor. https://www.ft.com/content/3e862e23-6e2c-4670-a68c-e204379fe01f?segmentId=b0d7e653-3467-12ab-c0f0-77e4424cdb4c
Suggestions for our Q submission this week ?

Thanks for sharing Marie. I find it comforting that human in the loop is still the norm and that the general actual use still is based on that. But it also means that AI Literacy is key for that oversight to be relevant at all.
I think this is a great question.
Maybe adding. What technical safeguards we be implemented?
Many are referring to importance of AI literacy, mentioning privacy and security. Any thoughts and ideas to address this ?
Thanks for suggestion, makes perfect sense. Lets see what rest of group wants before we finalise, still have a few days to go !

Thanks again for sharing this, Marie – it aligns so well with the orchestration themes we’ve discussed earlier.
I keep thinking about the distinction between agent performance and system responsibility:
Agents might execute tasks, but it’s the human orchestration layer that creates value and trust.

That’s exactly what I tried to explore in my piece on “Leading AI Agents with Purpose”  – and I’m now curious:
What does orchestration look like in real teams?
Is it clear who’s supervising? Who’s designing the agent workflows?

Would love to hear how others approach this in their orgs.

Thanks for this, Malin – I couldn’t agree more.
The idea that “less is more” feels especially relevant when GenAI makes it so easy to produce — but much harder to pause and review.

I see the same need in teams:
not just to use AI, but to develop a mindset of responsibility and reflection.
That’s why I often use PEACH as a guide for myself – especially the “H” and the “E”:

Are people confident enough to question the AI’s output?

Do they know they’re still accountable, even when GPT or another tool drafted it?

Your point about early-career training really hits home.
Maybe we need more micro-moments of guided friction before habits form?

Totally agree with the points raised so far especially around the need for orchestration and AI literacy. One thing that really stands out to me from my own experience in large, complex, matrixed organizations is just how hard it is to map workflows end to end. Processes are often informal, undocumented, spread across teams and no one fully owns them.

Bringing AI agents into that kind of environment actually forces reflection and clarity upfront. You can’t hand over a task to an agent if you don’t fully understand the handoffs, decision points, or who’s accountable. So before we get to orchestration or oversight, maybe the real first step is untangling and documenting those grey areas.

Curious if anyone’s found effective ways to do this.
Hi Buddy Group, what do you think about having a meeting together - virtual coffee exchange on the buddy group? Warm regards Andrea
Would love to! Is evening time ok for you all who wants to join? Otherwise morning or so Saturday/Sunday.
Yes, evening works for me
Hi Buddy group. I would suggest to keep our question from last week and bring it to the q and A?
I already put it in. Hope that is OK. If not please ad your suggestions. Thank you!
Any preference for the buddy get together , what day / evening would work best ?
Just putting some times out there. Saturday or Sunday at 10.00 or 17.00. I am on a busy offste next week so difficult then on my end except from Friday and onwards.
How about something like a bi-weekly check-in with coffee or whatever?  If we are in CET, I would suggest Wed or Thu, 17.30-18.30. Just a proposal.
Sounds good with me. Ideally Thursday if possible for rest of us. Looking forward to connecting.

Hi all sorry for my delay, too many things in parallel. Thursday sounds good for me. Do you prefer to meet in discord or should I set up a Google meet? Any suggestions what you would like to discuss? And Don t forget to bring your coffee 😊.
Thursday 17.30 works good for me, happy Sunday everyone
Hello and Happy Monday! Sound like a great time in general. This week I might not be able to make it though due to travel.

Hi everyone, I’m fine with that timing on a bi-weekly basis as suggested. Like Malin, i won’t be able to make it this Thursday due to an event I’m attending. I don’t want to slow anything down, so feel free to start this week already if most of you are available 😊

Hi all, ok great. I am on holidays next week, but let me plan directly the first personal exchange. So is Thursday the 5th of June 17.30 CET good for everyone? Thank you for confirming. Have a great start into the week. Andrea 🍑

I will try to attend but cant guarantee my presence as travelling and in meetings on June 5th.  But lets get these started ! And happy to catch up individually as well in case you want to share a virtual coffee in  the meantime.
A good opportunity to address questions to Oscar, our other cofounder of GenAI Global, on motivations and plans for this community. Any questions you would like to raise ?
I would be very interested in learning more about the new way to lead communities in the age of GenAI. Are there tips and tricks which can be shared?
let us not miss this opportunity to learn more about our incredible community!
@everyone

Based on input received so far: "How do you lead communities in the GenAI age? Any tips or tricks which can be shared?" I will post this tomorrow from Buddy Group 1 unless I have any other suggestions.
https://www.linkedin.com/events/insidegenaiglobal-liveq-awithfo7331033014556123136/theater/

Hi Buddy Group 1, 
A quick message on a personal note: Please pardon my silence these days. I have been sick for the last 10 days and I still will need to recover until the end of the week. Incredible how low you can get physically in just a few days! I hope to be able to be back to you guys at the end of this week and see for next steps. I am continuing my thoughts around the Goverance space. And I am also planning to start a practical case, which is a learning for me and where I hope to get the community's thoughts and inputs as well. 
Talk soon! 
René
<@1364573571686334547> Wishing you a speedy recovery. Looking forward to learning with you on the governance space, not a small topic !
Any suggestions or wishes on topics to cover for this weeks Q&A ?
What is an AI Agent, this is the topic for this weeks Q&A w Dr Sanchez. Any topic you would like to put forward?
@everyone
I suggest to post a question regarding "How do you prove your identity in an agentic world ? What solutions can be envisioned, eg blockchain, or other solutions that can ensure the trust element ?"
Thank you <@1359955242438889545> I like the question. I vote with yes.

Moorning Guys ! @everyone 
Remember  2morrows Keynote ! do not miss it !

https://www.linkedin.com/posts/gen-ai-global_genaiglobal-ai-innovation-activity-7332800237431832577-YLEu?utm_source=share&utm_medium=member_desktop&rcm=ACoAACS9ntIBUEGHMlt3-LjYyNIcYgzF_JjxEOg

Dear all, I was a little bit silent as I enjoyed my holidays with my family. Happy to be back and keep the ball rolling for our first virtual meeting. I would like to ask if it is possible to re-schedule Thursday the 5th of June 17.30 CET good for everyone. I am giving a speach on an AI Energy Summit and I am blocked the whole day. Please just let me know if Friday the 6th would also work for you? May be before the Q&A session? Kind regards Andrea

Welcome back Andrea. As mentioned earlier, I will be travelling on June 5-6 and on a flight on June 6th, but go ahead without me as I think great for group to get together, I will join on next occasion.

Hi everyone, I’ve been busy juggling work projects. Happy to meet on the 6th as suggested. Good luck with your event <@1361976806651068517> ⭐️
I’ve also been invited to speak at a webinar about AI, sustainability and communications 💪🏻
Also just back from a family vacation! Friday will be perfect for me.

**Invitation first Buddy Group Meeting virtual this Friday before the Q&A** <@1364826411566764043> <@1364837264827617284> <@1364573571686334547> <@1364721820313456643> <@1359955242438889545> 
 Meeting Link: Buddy Group Meeting Coffe Talk
Freitag, 6. Juni · 5:00 bis 5:30PM
Zeitzone: Europe/Berlin
Google Meet-Teilnahmeinformationen
Link für Videoanruf: https://meet.google.com/vrv-ueut-het
Oder telefonisch: ‪(DE) +49 40 8081618665‬ PIN: ‪915 156 258‬#
Weitere Telefonnummern: https://tel.meet/vrv-ueut-het?pin=8676757519103
My agenda suggestion for our Kick-off - please share your thoughts and addtional suggestions:
⏱️  Welcome & Purpose / „What motivated you to join a GenAI Buddy Group?“
⏱️ Mutual Mapping / "Let’s co-map what we’re each curious about." What’s something you’re trying to figure out right now? What excites or confuses you most about GenAI? What’s a small thing you’d like to experiment with in June?
⏱️ Next Step & Optional Goal
Have a good start into the week.
Thanks, Andrea! Looking forward to it. Happy week to all
Great! Looking forward!

Morning Everyone !
Tech Tip Tuesday ! 🪴☘️🌱🏵️

**Headline:** "I use ChatGPT to keep my houseplants happy — try these 5 game-changing prompts"
**Source / Date:** Tom's Guide, May 31, 2025
**Link:** https://www.tomsguide.com/ai/i-use-chatgpt-to-keep-my-houseplants-happy-try-these-5-game-changing-prompts
**Tip Summary:** This article demonstrates how ChatGPT can assist in plant care by providing tailored advice based on specific plant conditions. The author shares five effective prompts to diagnose plant issues, create customized care schedules, recommend optimal lighting setups, set up seasonal watering reminders, and identify unknown plants. By leveraging AI, plant enthusiasts can enhance their plant care routines, leading to healthier and happier houseplants.
**Action Step:** Ask ChatGPT: "My \[plant name] has \[describe symptoms]. It gets \[describe light], and I water it \[how often]. What could be the problem?"
